climbs.name: A Love Supreme
climbs.fa: FA Jon Stewart, Kevin Rauch 12-05 FFA Jon Stewart, Amy Stewart 2-06

content.description: Multi pitch that starts up Stairway to Heaven.  At second bolt traverse right past a bolt and then up to ledge.  A Love Supreme is the dihedral directly above.  Crux is getting into the dihedral (blind bolt around corner protects).  Climb up dihedral and then a nice bouldery move to gain ledges at top.
content.protection: Currently heady gear placements.  Will not be adding bolts.  Gear to 2" and 4 (.75 camolots)    I did add a directional bolt near the anchor up top so it is easier to top rope.  Leave it as a heady lead.

content.description:
Climb up to Heavens Ledge, and from there, step out left, and head up the (now) clean crack/dihedral. Fun climbing with plenty of good stemming to make it fairly easy.

You can also combine it with Jacob's Ladder to make for a stellar and long 5.8 route!
content.protection:
Gear to 2" if I remember right.

Shares anchors with Burrito Killa (5.10b) and There Y'ar (5.9)

content.description: Upon reaching the top of Jacob's Ladder, the route is the corner crack on your right.
content.protection: Pro to 3", maybe an extra BD #2 and extra BD #3

content.description: Easy good first lead climb, although the pro isn't great. lots of ledges, hence the name.To get to Heavens ledge,where the a few other climbs start, start up to the first two bolts is the same, you then climb right to the bolt on the face, around and up onto the ledge. Falling on Stairway to Heaven would be a shitty ass idea, because of its ledges chances are pretty good that you'll get bounced around.
content.protection:
3 Bolts, but there are a couple places to place gear, Camalots #.5-#1

The anchor is webbing around a large tree on a ledge to the left of Heaven's ledge.

climbs.name: Rolling Thunder
climbs.fa: FFA May 24, 2005 by Kevin Rauch and Jon Stewart

content.description:
5.10a climbing up to a tricky boulder problem.

Rolling Thunder can be connected with Burrito Killa (30m total).
content.location: Furthest left route that goes up to Heaven's Ledge.

content.description: Easy climbing past two bolts leads to a right side bulge and hand crack crux. Climbing eases as you approach heaven's ledge. Linking it with Burrito Killa makes this a great route.
content.protection: 4 or 5 bolts and a few cams to 2" (.75 and 2 BD, I think). Heaven's ledge has bolted anchors.
content.location: To the right of the Lion's head rock and Rolling Thunder follow a partial line of bolts up to a ledge with a large tree.

content.description: Climb the same start as Highway to Hell. From Heaven Ledge climb up and right onto an obvious ledge. Climb back out left and up to the first bolt. Has its own anchor.

This 45 foot route starts on Heaven's Ledge, but could be combined with any of the pitches currently ending on that Ledge. The route sports three bolts, as well as a few solid gear placements to avoid bad fall potential. Traverse right off Heaven's Ledge and mantle onto a ledge below a bolt. Crank past the bolt with reachy moves on jugs, then get to a good stance at the next bolt. Head up and right to the last bolt and continue up and right on steep terrain to a good stance above the bolt. Slightly tricky gear placements protect a low angle finish to the anchor above.
content.location: Starts on the right side of Heavens Ledge

climbs.name: Heaven and Hell
climbs.fa: Kevin Evansen, Sara Teegarden, Andreu Ferrero (May, 2019)

content.description: Climb past 4 bolts to some gear placements below and above a small tree. Anchor on face below heavens ledge.

Starts from Cloud 9 Ledge.  A bit of an adventure for Ozone!  (See info in "location" section on how to access the start).  From the belay anchor, traverse right around the corner to a ledge.  The crux is just above the ledge at the start of the climb.  Head up the face, following the bolt line.  Protect runouts with gear.  At the top of the wall, move left about 20 feet to the "A Love Supreme" anchor.   Two rappels.
content.protection: Gear to 1" and bolts (4 or 5? - at least one more than the 3 shown in the Ozone guidebook).  Anchors at top.
content.location:
Starts from the Cloud 9 Ledge (to the right of "Heaven's Ledge").  To access it, start climbing "Stairway to Heaven."  After the 2nd bolt, traverse up and right to another bolt.  After that, gear protects to the ledge and belay anchor. (Same as pitch 1 of "A Love Supreme.")

2 rappels down from the top anchors.

climbs.name: For Heaven Sake
climbs.fa: 06-11-2006 Jon Stewart, Amy Stewart, Jim Opdycke

content.description: Ascend ledges for ~30' up to an overhanging pod, place your first gear here. Above the overhang is a piton in a thin crack which can be backed up with a small cam. Climb through the overhang and head up to Heaven's Ledge anchors.
content.location: Start on good ledges just right of Jacob's Ladder (5.9)

climbs.name: Burrito Killa
climbs.fa: Kevin and Jeanean Rauch, Jon Stewart

content.description: Climbing around a sharp arete with balancy moves and small feet. Excellent exposure. Makes a good extension to Rolling Thunder (5.10d).
content.location: From Heaven's ledge head left onto the arete and up.

climbs.name: Bitches Brew
climbs.fa: 03-19-2006 Jon Stewart, Amy Stewart, Jim Opdycke & Lary Jennings

content.description:
A two pitch route that starts up Stairway to Heaven and at the second bolt traverses right past another bolt and then up to the Cloud 9 ledge.

Pitch 2: Climb the slab to the left placing gear and using a long sling on the bolt around the corner (awkward). Get on top of the large boulder and then continue up a face, roof and some ledges to the anchor.
content.protection:
Gear to 1"

Include a long sling
content.location: Uses the same first pitch as Love Supreme to gain Cloud 9 ledge.
